subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text: From Early {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=く}}. [[呉音#Japanese|Goon]], the initial reading when first borrowed into Japanese.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text: From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=きゅう}}. [[漢音#Japanese|Kan'on]], a later reading. Borrowed after palatalisation occurred in Middle Chinese.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|きゅう|hhira=きう}}

# [[nine]]
# an [[indeterminate]] [[large]] [[number]], a [[myriad]], a great many
# {{lb|ja|sort=きゅう|divination}} the number of [[yang]], in opposition to {{m|ja|六|tr=roku||six}} as the number of [[yin]]

subSections.title: Number
Usage notes
subSections.text: Generally only used when counting out loud, as in the example above. In writing, usually found spelled out in hiragana as {{ja-l|この}} to make the reading unambiguous.

subSections.title: References
subSections.text:
* The Japan Times (March 17, 2010). ''[http://www.kanjiclinic.com/kc102final.htm You can count on the tales behind number-kanji].'' Accessed March 23, 2010.
